column4: Anyone know what dir I can find the "XF86Config-4" file on the ubuntu live cd? Or better yet, does anyone have a working XFree86 config for a 17" G4 Powerbook (ati)?  Cant get my display working & I think the values for my HorizSync nd VertSync parameters are incorrect.
you might be looking for xorg.conf, if it's a newer cd
The only thing in /etc/X11 in the pcc ubuntu live cd is yaboot.conf
i'm not that familiar with the live cd, and not at all familiar with ppc, but that sounds wrong
you have booted off the live CD and there's no config file in /etc/X11 ?
i am viewing the iso in os x
Anyone have a working XFree86 config for a 17" Powerbook?  Cant get my display working & I think the values for my HorizSync nd VertSync parameters are incorrect.
you probably need to boot, maybe in text mode
btw: I dont know what im doing. but receiving help in #debianppc
i do not think the xorg.conf file will exist until you boot
